customer_reviews.title: I like the glass pot

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT COLD BREW for one to two people! Great quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love the flavor of my coffee this produces!! Hot coffee always upset my stomach. This cold brew process is AMAZING!!! And just the right size for one person. A full carafe lasts me two days. I just add almond milk, or coconut milk to it over ice and I have a yummy drink to start my day! Love the glass for easy cleaning and the stainless steel filter is easy to clean and looks great! I will be ordering more for gifts!!
customer_reviews.author: J. H.

customer_reviews.title: It’s easy to use
customer_reviews.text: So far this is working really well for me! I have an endless capacity for the flavor of strong coffee, so I don’t dilute much. This container makes a morning and a half’s coffee for me. It’s easy to use, easy to clean, easy to store. Before I had this coffee maker, I was making my cold brew in a mason jar and pouring it through a gold coffee filter. This is a lot more convenient and less messy.
customer_reviews.author: LuvBritLit

customer_reviews.title: The design and quality of the carafe is perfectly fine, but the issue lies in the fact that ...
customer_reviews.text: The design and quality of the carafe is perfectly fine, but the issue lies in the fact that the mesh filter is too wide. I've tried so many different strategies to decrease the amount of coffee dust that seeps into my brew, but I just can't manage to avoid it with this system. From what I hear, the Penguin brand system has a more fine mesh and reduces this problem. If you want to save 5 bucks and get this, I'm sure it'll work out fine. It's annoying, but not a total deal breaker, to have the dust in your brew.
customer_reviews.author: Cobby C.

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't filter 100% since the grounds are too fine, so I just don't drink the very last ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used just basic store brand coffee in it. It doesn't filter 100% since the grounds are too fine, so I just don't drink the very last bit out of the pitcher. It's still the smoothest cup of coffee I've had in a long time. I'm sure a coarser ground coffee would work wonderfully. Easy to prep, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Schmolleen

customer_reviews.title: Give me cold brew or give me death!
customer_reviews.text: If you're like me, you spend quite a bit if money on coffee every week. I'm in the military and my office runs on coffee. After some research, I decided on this coffee brewer for my cold brew. And it has worked perfectly! The metal filter inside is very fine and using all-purpose ground coffee has worked great with little to no coffee grounds in my mug. Simply follow the included instructions and you are on you're way to the best and cheapest cold brew there is!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Frey

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful & Fragile

The only issue I've had with the product is how fragile the lid is. Mine got a hit to the top and it cracked. Good thing they have a REMARKABLE customer service and they had sent me a replacement cap. I could not be more grateful. Thanks a million!

I also like it's funny shape and light-weight design. Very happy.

customer_reviews.title: I would say it holds more like 34 oz
customer_reviews.text: After playing around with the water to coffee ratio, I put in 15 T of coffee and fill up with water to the bottom edge of the pouring spout. One reviewer said this coffee maker held 50 oz. of water. They must have measured without the coffee and filter in it. I would say it holds more like 34 oz. of water max. I use a coarsely ground coffee and have had no problem with escaping coffee grounds. The Osaka Cold Brew Coffee Maker is easy to use and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: M. O. Barber

customer_reviews.title: Opposite schedule house + loud coffeemaker = problem
customer_reviews.text: My traditional coffeemaker has basically an industrial klaxon inside it and it squawks loudly enough to wake the entire house when I want to make even a tiny cup. So I got and use this instead. A few big spoons of coffee at night, I put it in the fridge, and in the morning I have plenty of concentrated cold brew in blissful silence. I haven't used my other coffeemaker in months. The company's customer service is so nice, too - I lost the stopper once and they verified my order and replaced it at no cost. (I would've paid - I love this thing.)
customer_reviews.author: Kay Rock

customer_reviews.title: Thin Glass but fits in Fridge
customer_reviews.text: Worked great at first but the glass is VERY thin and it didn't last the 5th time through the dishwasher (the handle broke off). I assume one of the other dishes ran into the handle inside the dishwasher. I like that it was tall and thin - not short and fat in my crowded refrigerator. Also, the stainless center cylinder filter (not cloth) seemed durable but released more coffee grounds through it than the semi-permeable plastic ones I've used in the past. I did not reorder a second one since the thin glass has me concerned. I'm going to try a different model.
customer_reviews.author: VaDavid

customer_reviews.title: Awesome! Used Daily
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome. We use it daily. It's 100% glass and the silicon seal around the lid comes off for easier cleaning. The entire thing goes in the dishwasher, no issue. We've run it through several times. The inner metal filter is very dense. Only the very tiniest of particles will get through - less than you'd see with a french press. We highly recommend this! Make sure you use coarse grounds (as recommended by the instructions).
customer_reviews.author: JulesJC

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I like this size. It's not too small and it's not as massive as the other ones. It fits nicely on the shelf of my fridge. Il appears to be of very high quality. I'm very happy with it and I will keep you updated. I have already made cold brew coffee and Thai tea. Suggestion to the seller, please include an extra rubber plug. I contacted the sellers who confirmed that is dishwasher safe. They are very responsive.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: An excellent and refreshing cup of coffee
customer_reviews.text: My review of the coffee...SOLD! No perceptible coffee grinds and a smooth taste. I used whole coffee beans and ground them on the course ground setting (also know as the French Press setting). I used 14 tbsps of coffee and about 6 cups of water. 1 cup I poured over the grounds, then waited 5 minutes to let the coffee bloom. Then I poured the remaining 5 cups. I let it sit on the counter overnight. It is a little strong for my taste, so I added a little water to the glass, cream and Splenda. Sooooo refreshing! I can easily imagine adding this to a personal blender and making blended coffee drinks!
customer_reviews.author: MoReviews

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!
customer_reviews.text: This makes THE best cold brew coffee! I'm grateful that the instructions said to let the grounds "bloom" for 5 minutes before filling completely. It makes a difference. I pour my glass in the morning and then refill the rest of the carafe. I can go almost a week before I need to change the grounds! Vermont Coffee Company coffee is perfect for this!
